title: Molecular Characterization of Lactic Acid Bacteria in Bakery and Pastry Starter Ferments.
authors: Kleib J, Rizk Z, Tannouri A, Abou-Khalil R
abstract: Bread is the oldest and most essential food consumed by humans, with its consumption exceeding nutritional needs and becoming part of cultural habits. Fermentation is an important step in the bread-making process, giving it its rheological, organoleptic, aromatic, and nutritional properties. Lactic acid bacteria and yeasts are both responsible for the fermentation step and part of the natural flour microbiota.
